column4: I just recompiled my kernel, now X wont start, it says in the log that it could not load the nvidia kernel modules. what do i have to do?
I just recompiled my kernel, now X wont start, it says in the log that it could not load the nvidia kernel modules. what do i have to do?
I just recompiled my kernel, now X wont start, it says in the log that it could not load the nvidia kernel modules. what do i have to do?
when you change kernel versions, you have to rebuild the nvidia drivers
last time I installed them I used automatix to do it.
so do exactly what you did initially when you installed the nvidia drivers
I don't use automatix, so I don't know if you can use it again
well at the moment i can't even start x. i think ill edit the xorg file and change it to vesa or nv and see if that will get me going
thanks ill give it a shot
kernel modules must match the running kernel
yeah, i have a stock standard ubuntu install with linux-686 and the module that comes with the package doesnt work.
effectively that means you have to build the kernel module locally.
yeah i think ill just grab the source and build it
it's common, in a binary distro they update the kernel, and then all sorts of modules refuse to load
